commit_message:
Allow tuning of Galera gcache size

Appropriate gcache.size values allow a cluster node to perform IST
instead of SST if the writes occurred during its downtime do not exceed
the size of the cache itself.
This is especially beneficial during maintenance windows.

Closes-Bug: #1939540

Change-Id: I483484c58ab703f3a4dcede636d733e23b051f63
(cherry picked from commit feed67dcc45eb3da818cc2ceac8cb3682a2b6364)

commit_message:
Use different name to distinguish between facts and vars in octavia

ansible facts take precedence over vars in ansible apparently so octavia
controller configuration did not properly update certificates on hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1939445
Change-Id: I42e8993825c9ed956543755daf8cb6e414b1d790

The main problem was the tag was not updated when resource was renamed in puppet side.

commit_message:
Add <service>_api_paste_ini in puppet_tags

Most of the services are either missing or using deprecated tags for
paste deploy configuration. Add those for us to be able to customize
paste deploy.

Also, removes the unnecessary tag from nova-compute.

Change-Id: I699b9283c7dbdb59923007488b4ac6c359d6eced

commit_message:
Support reading Kayobe environment name from file

If using separate branches for each environment, it can be useful to
read the environment name from a file committed to each branch. Or, if
sharing the same branch for all environments, it can be useful to set
the default environment to one with lower impact, e.g. dev or staging.

If no --environment option is specified and a .environment file exists
at the root of the directory, use its content as KAYOBE_ENVIRONMENT.

Change-Id: I22b2b466e47a3b4d96931d754a4de7544f0ada5d
(cherry picked from commit 2af2c3a3b5387c577801b165ecd749fe782fddb9)

commit_message:
Support specifying a Kayobe environment to use

This also includes a cherry-pick of
I9a44578196086ec24de80b992fed385826778feb, Stop accessing unbound
variables.

The kayobe-env script would try accessing $1 which is an unbound
variable if no argument is passed. This fails when `set -u` is set.

Also refactor usage output into a function. As a side effect, a missing
argument to --environment now causes the script to properly exit with an
error.

Change-Id: I604c2ae6c47ef16fdc98e0598cad820e49e2ff26
Story: 2002009
Task: 41577
(cherry picked from commit 75b6402f8b0d4e39c40a1d11091ca760d8b99dee)

commit_message:
Adds release note for DHCP changes

This applies to DPDK evironments

Manila note was removed. It will be published as an
upgrade note instead.

commit_message:
Remove haproxy_check_script for UDP-only LBs

This file is created when no HAProxy listeners exist so VRRP will fail,
but needs to be removed when a UDP listener is added so that VRRP can
actually correctly start.

Story: 2008133
Task: 40859

Change-Id: Ib2a80afb9223da2c0af6f6add250ffaaa20a316f
(cherry picked from commit 0ce9add9d9c7319104fa3ca2e6852b8166234f06)

commit_message:
Added handler for mysql 8.0.19 duplicate key error update

In mysql 8.0.19 , Duplicate key error information is extended to
include the table name of the key.Previously, duplicate key error
information included only the key value and key name.

Unit tests are provided for updated changes.

Change-Id: Ic78059b625e73cece355541cb4d89e641abc1103
Closes-Bug: #1896916
(cherry picked from commit 2c2e6d48ace2d91dce94d2e62fb0bdda904bc2bd)
(cherry picked from commit b32b643acc0528099a88504d4d824cdc002a85df)

commit_message:
Add meta to mistral

Mistral didn't get the meta/ information that is usually present
on all our roles.

This fixes it. I added mnaser and his company in meta, as he is
the original author of this role.
At the opposite of other roles, I didn't add the apt dependency.

Change-Id: Iba8ae5e8ded1398649792ecc5b4d9267551713c4
(cherry picked from commit 432a90e4e409c1137246979905b59fc4639a1014)

commit_message:
afsdocs_secret-tox-docs-site: Zuul 4.6.0 fix

Adjust the afsdocs_secret-tox-docs-site secret to use the new
targets tree expected by the opendev-promote-docs-base job expects.
This should solve recent failures for the promote-airship-project-docs
job when run triggered from any branch other than master

Change-Id: If454c0dfc126e23e92a68356acd7ec7e50a6c51c

commit_message:
ironic: Follow up for ironic_enable_keystone_integration

Follow up for I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9 which added a
ironic_enable_keystone_integration variable to support Ironic in
multi-region environments. This change skips Keystone service
registration based on ironic_enable_keystone_integration rather than
enable_keystone. It also updates the ironic-inspector.conf template to
use the new variable.

Change-Id: I2ecba4999e194766258ac5beed62877d43829313
(cherry picked from commit 46df30d87140d182acfc70b005fb8b29a4589c12)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 13:30:04.000000000', 'message': "Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)
"}]
commit_message:
Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)

commit_message:
Extract the volume ID from Glance multistore URLs.

If Glance is run with multiple backends, the URL for a Cinder volume's
location contains an additional component, e.g. cinder://main/uuid.

Change-Id: I8705f2a9c01b191fe009c530fffa26e71b4d4398
Closes-Bug: #1939242

commit_message:
Refactor gateway auth layer for member APIs

This makes us able to optionally not get the authorization layer on
top of the stack. It also don't insert the policy layer in the
middle of the stack.

Related blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: Idd62a1dd18302c39e154b541e32e65a8a2085517

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 20:30:52.000000000', 'message': 'Set ganesha_vip when no StoragetNFS network

is deployed.

Normally when Ganesha is deployed for CephFS through NFS,
the StorageNFS isolated network is deployed and we set
the address for ganesha_vip on that network.  But with
Standalone role the StorageNFS network is not deployed
so ganesha_vip is not set in the tripleo hieradata unless
it is provided by extra config.

Set it to net_vip_map.external in the event that it has
not been set on the StorageNFS network.  Note that external
is chosen rather than ctlplane since the VIP must be reachable
from compute instances, guest VMs, that should have no access
to the ctlplane network.

Closes-Bug: #1911022
Change-Id: Ia97533c0b8b3b8498a173e1d363323dcdc77cce4
(cherry picked from commit 0aceca00e76e967ee9b5efc30da0bc3ee23acb2e)
(cherry picked from commit 520b1e1edb83d9f9e101695900667c80a4cdbc8f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff85eb7db7636ff395ba6f2da0f6fda7b6f1a24)
'}]
commit_message:
Set ganesha_vip when no StoragetNFS network

is deployed.

Normally when Ganesha is deployed for CephFS through NFS,
the StorageNFS isolated network is deployed and we set
the address for ganesha_vip on that network.  But with
Standalone role the StorageNFS network is not deployed
so ganesha_vip is not set in the tripleo hieradata unless
it is provided by extra config.

Set it to net_vip_map.external in the event that it has
not been set on the StorageNFS network.  Note that external
is chosen rather than ctlplane since the VIP must be reachable
from compute instances, guest VMs, that should have no access
to the ctlplane network.

Closes-Bug: #1911022
Change-Id: Ia97533c0b8b3b8498a173e1d363323dcdc77cce4
(cherry picked from commit 0aceca00e76e967ee9b5efc30da0bc3ee23acb2e)
(cherry picked from commit 520b1e1edb83d9f9e101695900667c80a4cdbc8f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff85eb7db7636ff395ba6f2da0f6fda7b6f1a24)

commit_message:
healthcheck: Limit source IP range

This change introduces the new [healthcheck] allowed_source_ranges
option, to restrict access to healthcheck endpoint within specific
network ranges. This parameter is useful to avoid access from external
network, because healthcheck endpoint has no authentication usually.

Change-Id: I2b88704c260edd1a4c49cfde9de4cee4b90be862

commit_message:
Don't pass strings to Connection.execute()

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Passing a string to Connection.execute() is deprecated and will be
  removed in version 2.0.  Use the text() construct, or the
  Connection.exec_driver_sql() method to invoke a driver-level SQL
  string.

Change-Id: I1faa8c957649a04aa080518651045b432c6bd372
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding centos-8-stream job for ovs

Removing centos-8 CI jobs and replace with centos-8-stream job because
centos-8.x is EOL soon and will get replace with stream. Also adding
job for centos-8-stream OVN deployment.

Change-Id: Ibbcc071c2dbf10969d305ebb6f49e372adf0a370

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 21:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'fluentd: Fix check for external elasticsearch

When enable_elasticsearch is False, and kolla_internal_fqdn is set
and elasticsearch_address is the default, fluentd is still enabling
output to elasticsearch.

elasticsearch_address defaults to kolla_internal_fqdn, but the
check to enable logging to an "external" elasticsearch host
compares with kolla_internal_vip_address (fqdn != vip address).

This patch fixes the comparison to use the kolla_internal_fqdn.

Closes-Bug: #1927880
Change-Id: If23a6b1273c2639d1296becc9d222546d52f63ac
'}, {'created': '2021-05-24 06:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'fluentd: Fix check for external elasticsearch

When enable_elasticsearch is False, and kolla_internal_fqdn is set
and elasticsearch_address is the default, fluentd is still enabling
output to elasticsearch.

commit_message:
fluentd: Fix check for external elasticsearch

When enable_elasticsearch is False, and kolla_internal_fqdn is set
and elasticsearch_address is the default, fluentd is still enabling
output to elasticsearch.

elasticsearch_address defaults to kolla_internal_fqdn, but the
check to enable logging to an "external" elasticsearch host
compares with kolla_internal_vip_address (fqdn != vip address).

This patch fixes the comparison to use the kolla_internal_fqdn.

Closes-Bug: #1927880
Change-Id: If23a6b1273c2639d1296becc9d222546d52f63ac

(2 comments)

CentOS Linux images use stream as a base: https://8a28d37c8a21ba47ad86-2bdb8be3dd1329f8a48d0e165eec17e9.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/792763/17/check/kolla-build-centos8-source/8f66085/kolla/build/base.log'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:03:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Support matrix needs stream adding as a distro. Currently the supported images are the same, so we could keep existing columns. We'll need some docs describing how to build stream images. Here's what we added for Train:

diff --git a/doc/source/admin/image-building.rst b/doc/source/admin/image-building.rst
index 7adfcac21..6f6d3a4cd 100644
--- a/doc/source/admin/image-building.rst
+++ b/doc/source/admin/image-building.rst
@@ -74,6 +74,25 @@ There are following distros available for building images:
 - rhel
 - ubuntu
 
+See the :ref:`support matrix <support-matrix-base-images>` for information on
+supported base image distribution versions and supported images on each
+distribution.
+
+The Train ``9.1.0`` release supports both CentOS 7 and 8 base container images.
+The default is to use CentOS 7. CentOS 8 may be used as follows:
+
+.. code-block:: console
+
+   kolla-build --base centos --base-tag 8
+
+Kolla uses the tag to set defaults for the distribution Python version and
+package manager. If you need to use a base image with a different tag, use the
+following options:
+
+.. code-block:: console
+
+   kolla-build --base centos --base-image <base image> --base-tag <base tag> --distro-package-manager dnf --distro-python-version 3.6
+
 .. warning::
 
    Fedora images are deprecated since Newton and will be removed"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Added kolla-ansible jobs here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/798892'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-02 11:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-03 09:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

commit_message:
Use selectinload for all list queries

Since node objects *can* be large, and due to the nature of joined
record dedeuplication, we should avoid them for list operations to
speed the operation to completion by *instead* allowing the client
to execute three queries and reconcile versus dedeuplicate the
single node.

This *should* result in generally faster list interaction, and
preserves the behavior for nodes at this time in order to
minimize a drastic increase of SQL queries for individual nodes.

Change-Id: Iac457e483068f613ded2aeff60cf6d9fc64a7dac

ironic_enable_keystone_integration variable to support Ironic in

use the new variable.

commit_message:
ironic: Follow up for ironic_enable_keystone_integration

Follow up for I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9 which added a
ironic_enable_keystone_integration variable to support Ironic in
multi-region environments. This change skips Keystone service
registration based on ironic_enable_keystone_integration rather than
enable_keystone. It also updates the ironic-inspector.conf template to
use the new variable.

Change-Id: I2ecba4999e194766258ac5beed62877d43829313
(cherry picked from commit 46df30d87140d182acfc70b005fb8b29a4589c12)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 13:26:32.000000000', 'message': "Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)
"}]
commit_message:
Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)

commit_message:
Fix Redfish RAID interface_type physical disk hint

Map between sushy's protocol and RAID config schema's
interface_type constants.

Not supporting `scsi` from RAID schema as Redfish does
not support it in Protocol property.

Change-Id: Ic042f0a87ff0723f313adb3888c24c5963624182
(cherry picked from commit c41ed8414d6559535026f513c7e5e8a35824f549)

commit_message:

This reverts commit 9dc2b88eb42a5f98f43bc8ad3dfa3962a4d44d74.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 13:06:55.000000000', 'message': 'monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm

monasca-thresh currently runs a local copy of the storm
to handle the threshold topology.  However, it doesn't setup
the environment correctly, and the executable fails, causing
the container to continually restart.

This patch updates the container command to correctly
submit the topology to the running Apache storm.  The
container will exit after it finishes the submission,
so the restart_policy is updated to on-failure, this way
if the storm is temporarily unavailable, the submission
will be retried. (NOTE: further deploys will see the
container as "changed" as it won't be running)

Patch uses KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP to trigger the container to
check if the topology is already submitted, and if so skips
the submission command so the container doesn't fail.

The config task now triggers a new reconfigure handler that
spawns a one-shot container to replace any existing topology
if the configuration has changed.

Also, all the storm.* variables in storm.yml.j2 are
removed as they were only needed for local mode and
make submitted topologies fail to load when the storm
is restarted (the referenced directories not mounted
on nimbus).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804018
Closes-Bug: #1808805
Change-Id: Ib225d76076782d695c9387e1c2693bae9a4521d7
(cherry picked from commit aea9bf355058a15e7ce7bb2649de3872e7041c89)
'}]
commit_message:
monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm

monasca-thresh currently runs a local copy of the storm
to handle the threshold topology.  However, it doesn't setup
the environment correctly, and the executable fails, causing
the container to continually restart.

This patch updates the container command to correctly
submit the topology to the running Apache storm.  The
container will exit after it finishes the submission,
so the restart_policy is updated to on-failure, this way
if the storm is temporarily unavailable, the submission
will be retried. (NOTE: further deploys will see the
container as "changed" as it won't be running)

Patch uses KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP to trigger the container to
check if the topology is already submitted, and if so skips
the submission command so the container doesn't fail.

The config task now triggers a new reconfigure handler that
spawns a one-shot container to replace any existing topology
if the configuration has changed.

Also, all the storm.* variables in storm.yml.j2 are
removed as they were only needed for local mode and
make submitted topologies fail to load when the storm
is restarted (the referenced directories not mounted
on nimbus).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804018
Closes-Bug: #1808805
Change-Id: Ib225d76076782d695c9387e1c2693bae9a4521d7
(cherry picked from commit aea9bf355058a15e7ce7bb2649de3872e7041c89)

commit_message:
Add doc to configure node before network config

Deployments which requires configuration to be applied after
kernel args and reboot but before network config requires
additional steps, which are explained in this document.

Change-Id: I9ce1baa4f6a9b9ab3ffe17a0bd81725284e77975

Using or importing the Iterable from 'collections'
instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated

commit_message:
Support multiple inventories

Multiple inventories can now be passed to `kolla-ansible`.  This can be
useful to construct a common inventory that is shared between multiple
environments.

Change-Id: I2ac5d7851b310bea2ba362b353f18c592a0a6a2e

# traefik
Deploying trafik from master branch will default to version 2.4.9 and the deployment is managed by helm.
Create the cluster with:
```
openstack coe cluster create --keypair dtomasgu-key --cluster-template kubernetes-1.21.1-2 --merge-labels --labels ingress_controller=traefik --labels monitoring_enabled=true --labels helm_client_tag=v3.2.1  --labels helm_client_sha256=018f9908cb950701a5d59e757653a790c66d8eda288625dbb185354ca6f41f6b traefik-v2
```

To assure backwards compatibility, the version 1 of traefik is installed in the old way and it is only triggered if the traefik_ingress_controller_tag starts wit v1.

```
openstack coe cluster create --keypair dtomasgu-key --cluster-template kubernetes-1.21.1-2 --merge-labels --labels ingress_controller=traefik --labels traefik_ingress_controller_tag=v1.7.28 --labels monitoring_enabled=true --labels helm_client_tag=v3.2.1 --labels helm_client_sha256=018f9908cb950701a5d59e757653a790c66d8eda288625dbb185354ca6f41f6b traefik-v1
```

+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------+-----------------+------------+--------------+-----------------+---------------+
| uuid                                 | name                        | keypair         | node_count | master_count | status          | health_status |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------+-----------------+------------+--------------+-----------------+---------------+
| f945405c-f810-49b7-bebf-a389cdd36c99 | traefik-v2                  | dtomasgu-key    |          1 |            1 | CREATE_COMPLETE | None          |
| 3fc621bf-c6e2-4ded-a080-b969b0c49bab | traefik-v1                  | dtomasgu-key    |          1 |            1 | CREATE_COMPLETE | None          |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------+-----------------+------------+--------------+-----------------+---------------+


For traefik V1 cluster:
```
$ ka get no
NAME                               STATUS   ROLES    AGE     VERSION
traefik-v1-gm6c46iamuts-master-0   Ready    master   11m     v1.21.1
traefik-v1-gm6c46iamuts-node-0     Ready    <none>   8m46s   v1.21.1

$ kubectl label no traefik-v1-gm6c46iamuts-node-0 role=ingress
node/traefik-v1-gm6c46iamuts-node-0 labeled

$ ka get po
NAMESPACE       NAME                                                  READY   STATUS             RESTARTS   AGE
kube-system     ingress-traefik-l9knw                                    1/1     Running            0          15s


$ ks get -o json po ingress-traefik-l9knw | jq '.spec.containers[].image'
"foo.bar/magnum/traefik:v1.7.28"
```

From ```http://localhost:9090/prometheus/targets```

We can find that metrics are being collected:
```kube-system/prometheus-traefik-metrics/0 (1/1 up)```




For traefik V2 cluster:
```
$ ka get no
NAME                               STATUS   ROLES    AGE     VERSION
traefik-v2-fwl4dkknelyv-master-0   Ready    master   5m24s   v1.21.1
traefik-v2-fwl4dkknelyv-node-0     Ready    <none>   2m52s   v1.21.1

$ ks label no traefik-v2-fwl4dkknelyv-node-0 role=ingress
node/traefik-v2-fwl4dkknelyv-node-0 labeled

$ ka get po
NAMESPACE       NAME                                                     READY   STATUS             RESTARTS   AGE
kube-system     magnum-traefik-zzpts                                     1/1     Running            0          61s


$ ks get -o json po magnum-traefik-zzpts | jq '.spec.containers[].image'
"foo.bar/magnum/traefik:v2.4.9"
```

From ```http://localhost:9090/prometheus/targets```

We can find that metrics are being collected:
```kube-system/prometheus-traefik-metrics/0 (1/1 up)```'}]

[{'created': '2021-08-09 13:12:40.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144

(cherry picked from commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)

commit_message:
Enable priority overrides to enable/disable steps

Generic way to configure clean step priorites feature
( https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/744117 ) enabled support
for customising clean step priorities for any clean step by setting a
configuration option. However, due to an error in code, it was not possible
to use this feature to enable/disable steps entirely using this option
as overrides were applied too late, after the disabled steps were already
filtered out.

This change fixes this error, making it possible to use step priority
override configuration option to enable/disable steps as required.

Story: 2009105
Change-Id: If3c01e6e4e8cedfe053e78fab9632bfff3682b06

commit_message:
manila: add glance section in manila-share.conf

Since the Victoria release, manila-share.conf requires a glance section
for some drivers. This change adds the missing section.

It also uses the correct cinder_keystone_user variable to reference the
cinder user.

Closes-Bug: #1921935

Change-Id: Ib7ce4ed79c28456281087eb4156577f910c072e7
(cherry picked from commit 2e4f51f671b4e14fd58a67f1a22106c09c037eed)

[{'created': '2021-08-09 13:12:07.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)

commit_message:
Allow empty MANILA_PASSWORD to harden security

There is a check for empty value of
`DIB_MANILA_USER_PASSWORD` in
`elements/manila-ssh/install.d/50-manila-user` already.

Just allow to set MANILA_PASSWORD empty.

Change-Id: I08ee3e643bb0c6208bda7caadc11f865617163f3
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>

commit_message:
manila: add glance section in manila-share.conf

Since the Victoria release, manila-share.conf requires a glance section
for some drivers. This change adds the missing section.

It also uses the correct cinder_keystone_user variable to reference the
cinder user.

Closes-Bug: #1921935

Change-Id: Ib7ce4ed79c28456281087eb4156577f910c072e7
(cherry picked from commit 2e4f51f671b4e14fd58a67f1a22106c09c037eed)

'}, {'created': '2021-08-02 07:33:27.000000000', 'message': "Test validations for false positives

By running validations with arguments intentionally chosen
to make the validation requirements impossible to fulfill,
we can check how the framework handles failures, and if
the tested validations do not produce false positives.

The functional test now, in addition to the existing
set of checks, allow for optional 'negative_results' testing.

Variables entries for all tested validations are checked
for the presence of 'negative_results' dictionary key.
If it is found, the 'extra_args' key contents within are used
to run the validation in question, after it has passed the test
for a successful validation run.

The 'negative results' run is expected to fail, failure is supressed,
and result recorded. Passing result, conversely, is interpreted as an error,
because validation passing shouldn't be possible with the arguments supplied.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If7e7b25b9c876184bd04f3f0ddefdee20172a5b4

commit_message:
Test validations for false positives

By running validations with arguments intentionally chosen
to make the validation requirements impossible to fulfill,
we can check how the framework handles failures, and if
the tested validations do not produce false positives.

The functional test now, in addition to the existing
set of checks, allow for optional 'negative_results' testing.

Variables entries for all tested validations are checked
for the presence of 'negative_results' dictionary key.
If it is found, the 'extra_args' key contents within are used
to run the validation in question, after it has passed the test
for a successful validation run.

The 'negative results' run is expected to fail, failure is supressed,
and result recorded. Passing result, conversely, is interpreted as an error,
because validation passing shouldn't be possible with the arguments supplied.

Show validations test was patched to proper form of the command.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If7e7b25b9c876184bd04f3f0ddefdee20172a5b4

subject: Remove old workarounds for broken crm_diff

commit_message:
Remove old workarounds for broken crm_diff

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output (and is a lot simpler).

We can remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton and
Centos 7 are unsupported.

Tested as follows:
- Deployed a fresh Train overcloud w/ this change
- Ran a redeployment forcing a config change on an HA bundle
- Ran another redeployment forcing a CIB change on an HA bundle
  OVNDBSPacemakerMonitorIntervalSlave: 666
  observed that the bundle was restarted correctly:
  [root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource config ovn-dbs-bundle |grep 666
     monitor interval=666s role=Slave timeout=60s (ovndb_servers-monitor-interval-666s)
- Also tested in CI via https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/803101

Change-Id: Iba736839ae12f3adf180b53cd7fc5c552d03bd47

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 14:49:48.000000000', 'message': "Disable mlockall if postcopy is enabled

If postcopy is enabled, live migration fails with:
2021-07-26 10:37:15.563 7 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: 5bd7e565-8744-4965-85f9-61f1e2bb6b8d] Live Migration failure: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported: libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported

The root cause is that ovs gets started per default with --mlockall=yes.
As a result postcopy gets disabled and live migration fails.

2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00011|dpdk|WARN|vhost-postcopy-support and mlockall are not compatible.
2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00012|dpdk|INFO|POSTCOPY support for vhost-user-client disabled.

This change adds --mlockall=no to /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch
to have live migration working.

Change-Id: I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1
Closes-Bug: 1939028
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
"}, {'created': '2021-08-05 14:50:50.000000000', 'message': "Disable mlockall if postcopy is enabled

If postcopy is enabled, live migration fails with:
2021-07-26 10:37:15.563 7 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: 5bd7e565-8744-4965-85f9-61f1e2bb6b8d] Live Migration failure: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported: libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported

The root cause is that ovs gets started per default with --mlockall=yes.
As a result postcopy gets disabled and live migration fails.

2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00011|dpdk|WARN|vhost-postcopy-support and mlockall are not compatible.
2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00012|dpdk|INFO|POSTCOPY support for vhost-user-client disabled.

This change adds --mlockall=no to /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch
to have live migration working.

Change-Id: I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1
Closes-Bug: #1939028
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
"}]
commit_message:
Disable mlockall if postcopy is enabled

If postcopy is enabled, live migration fails with:
2021-07-26 10:37:15.563 7 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: 5bd7e565-8744-4965-85f9-61f1e2bb6b8d] Live Migration failure: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported: libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: unable to execute QEMU command 'migrate-set-capabilities': Postcopy is not supported

The root cause is that ovs gets started per default with --mlockall=yes.
As a result postcopy gets disabled and live migration fails.

2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00011|dpdk|WARN|vhost-postcopy-support and mlockall are not compatible.
2021-08-04T12:18:10.737Z|00012|dpdk|INFO|POSTCOPY support for vhost-user-client disabled.

This change adds --mlockall=no to /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch
to have live migration working.

Change-Id: I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1
Closes-Bug: #1939028
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 07:23:56.000000000', 'message': "Rephrase QoSRuleParameterConflict message

The name of QoSRuleParameterConflict exception class suggests that
it's a generic exception that can be used by multiple QoS rules to
raise a parameter conflict. On the other hand, exception's message
refers to bandwidth which could be confusing when used with QoS
minimum packet rate rule.

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I05d33fd3337b755b1b0b8a5986739c76a1db3d84
"}]
commit_message:
Rephrase QoSRuleParameterConflict message

The name of QoSRuleParameterConflict exception class suggests that
it's a generic exception that can be used by multiple QoS rules to
raise a parameter conflict. On the other hand, exception's message
refers to bandwidth which could be confusing when used with QoS
minimum packet rate rule.

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I05d33fd3337b755b1b0b8a5986739c76a1db3d84

commit_message:
Fix OVN metadata protocol to point https

In OSA recently we moved all our LB endpoint vips to https or all SSL
and that break ovn metadata which was default using http. This patch
will fix that and allow us to override variable.

Change-Id: Ia9189adae01d8515e392abdbede7fd7b3f89e02e

commit_message:
swift: Take into account swift_store_endpoint

In SingleTenant authv3 context, connection manager does not evaluate
swift_store_endpoint and always takes endpoint from catalog.

The change ensures CONF.glance_store.swift_store_endpoint
will take over catalog value also in that case.

Closes-Bug: #1885651
Change-Id: Ib18ff19cd539e0117909f849672036b8c9e5f049

commit_message:
Replace centos-8.x jobs with centos-8-stream

CentOS-8.x is EOL in end of 2021. It has some broken repo causing
failures. This patch will drop centos-8 jobs and replace with new
centos-8-stream.

Set all OVN jobs to non voting to merge required patches to fix OVN.

Change-Id: I89bcf25dfad355c52f1f7d8efee16b20c584da53

commit_message:
Set ovn hostname using nodename facts

Ansible hostname facts using short hostname which may not work for
other senario where compute hostname is set to FQDN. OVN required
ovs set hostname and compute hostname should be same.

Change-Id: I585f73551c5a90841dcf2d1dd94a3e1fc90b04ac

commit_message:
manila: add glance section in manila-share.conf

Since the Victoria release, manila-share.conf requires a glance section
for some drivers. This change adds the missing section.

It also uses the correct cinder_keystone_user variable to reference the
cinder user.

Closes-Bug: #1921935

Change-Id: Ib7ce4ed79c28456281087eb4156577f910c072e7
(cherry picked from commit 2e4f51f671b4e14fd58a67f1a22106c09c037eed)

subject: Make setup module arguments configurable
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-30 12:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-07-30 12:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-02 09:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 12:34:45.000000000', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kolla_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kolla_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kolla_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kolla_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kolla Ansible.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

For reference, here are some other tunings tried:

* Increased the number of forks (great speedup depending of the size of
  the deployment)
* Use `strategy = mitogen_linear` (cut processing time in half)
* Ansible caching (little speed up)
* SSH tunning (little speed up)

Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kolla_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kolla_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kolla_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kolla_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kolla Ansible.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

For reference, here are some other tunings tried:

* Increased the number of forks (great speedup depending of the size of
  the deployment)
* Use `strategy = mitogen_linear` (cut processing time in half)
* Ansible caching (little speed up)
* SSH tunning (little speed up)

commit_message:
Fix nova deployment failure when rabbitmq is disabled

Nova always tries to create the rabbitmq user regardless of
whether RabbitMQ is enabled or not.
This ps also adds an external rabbitmq doc.

(cherry picked from commit 24d08142d2ecaf6e8baa40a1fe972b61e1731687)

subject: baremetal: use docker_yum_gpgkey to fetch docker GPG key
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 08:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 10:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 08:05:24.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: use docker_yum_gpgkey to fetch docker GPG key

Currently, if you override docker_yum_url, the repo must contain a GPG
key at {{ docker_yum_url }}/gpg, despite the fact that the GPG key URL
can be overridden separately via docker_yum_gpgkey. This change uses
docker_yum_gpgkey consistently, avoiding the need to keep the key in the
repo.

Closes-Bug: #1934913
Change-Id: If8e6a02ce0760123f7b076c711727ef575965192
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: use docker_yum_gpgkey to fetch docker GPG key

Currently, if you override docker_yum_url, the repo must contain a GPG
key at {{ docker_yum_url }}/gpg, despite the fact that the GPG key URL
can be overridden separately via docker_yum_gpgkey. This change uses
docker_yum_gpgkey consistently, avoiding the need to keep the key in the
repo.

Closes-Bug: #1934913
Change-Id: If8e6a02ce0760123f7b076c711727ef575965192

subject: Blazar: Fix support for external keystone in multiregion deploy
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-09 09:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 08:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 09:00:10.000000000', 'message': 'Blazar: Fix support for external keystone in multiregion deploy

We need to correctly set keystone auth api for all cases.
By default [1] the keystone_internal_fqdn is equal to the
kolla_internal_fqdn, but in multiregion deploy it can be overriden.

1. https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/3a7440b370f5c2bf6f255a6530349a3e680007b9/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L834

Change-Id: Ib40aafaa9ca360d57e87ffdd81dbc15e603fef99
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Blazar: Fix support for external keystone in multiregion deploy

We need to correctly set keystone auth api for all cases.
By default [1] the keystone_internal_fqdn is equal to the
kolla_internal_fqdn, but in multiregion deploy it can be overriden.

1. https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/3a7440b370f5c2bf6f255a6530349a3e680007b9/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L834

Change-Id: Ib40aafaa9ca360d57e87ffdd81dbc15e603fef99
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Blazar: Fix support for external keystone in multiregion deploy

We need to correctly set keystone auth api for all cases.
By default [1] the keystone_internal_fqdn is equal to the
kolla_internal_fqdn, but in multiregion deploy it can be overriden.

1. https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/3a7440b370f5c2bf6f255a6530349a3e680007b9/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L834

Change-Id: Ib40aafaa9ca360d57e87ffdd81dbc15e603fef99
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix nova deployment failure when rabbitmq is disabled

Nova always tries to create the rabbitmq user regardless of
whether RabbitMQ is enabled or not.
This ps also adds an external rabbitmq doc.

Change-Id: Iec517226e4c82ea351889b55689a3efceaadcc76
(cherry picked from commit 24d08142d2ecaf6e8baa40a1fe972b61e1731687)

subject: Elevated privileges required to set owner/group/mode by ansible
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-09 08:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 08:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 08:51:40.000000000', 'message': "Elevated privileges required to set owner/group/mode by ansible

Elevated (root) privileges are required to set owner/group/mode when
target owner does not math the user running Ansible. Without it the
playbook fails with 'Permission denied' error.

Change-Id: Ie7455a5f1ed709dfb9c9d7c653c6f808c00af4c2
"}]
commit_message:
Elevated privileges required to set owner/group/mode by ansible

Elevated (root) privileges are required to set owner/group/mode when
target owner does not math the user running Ansible. Without it the
playbook fails with 'Permission denied' error.

Change-Id: Ie7455a5f1ed709dfb9c9d7c653c6f808c00af4c2

commit_message:
Elevated privileges required to set owner/group/mode by ansible

Elevated (root) privileges are required to set owner/group/mode when
target owner does not math the user running Ansible. Without it the
playbook fails with 'Permission denied' error.

commit_message:
Blazar: Fix support for external keystone in multiregion deploy

We need to correctly set keystone auth api for all cases.
By default [1] the keystone_internal_fqdn is equal to the
kolla_internal_fqdn, but in multiregion deploy it can be overriden.

1. https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/3a7440b370f5c2bf6f255a6530349a3e680007b9/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L834

Change-Id: Ib40aafaa9ca360d57e87ffdd81dbc15e603fef99
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-08-10 14:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 14:58:17.000000000', 'message': 'Force immediate NTP time sync with chronyd at IPA startup

In order to make sure we have the correct time early, e.g.
by the time we create a TLS certificate, this patch proposes
to force an immediate NTP update when using chronyd. While
the previous approach uses the passed NTP server as well, the
update may happen only after chronyd has performed measurements
(which may be too late).

Story: #2009058

(cherry picked from commit 5531d5cee744f90ff24231a9ef467282b254adc2)

commit_message:
Force immediate NTP time sync with chronyd at IPA startup

In order to make sure we have the correct time early, e.g.
by the time we create a TLS certificate, this patch proposes
to force an immediate NTP update when using chronyd. While
the previous approach uses the passed NTP server as well, the
update may happen only after chronyd has performed measurements
(which may be too late).

Story: #2009058
Task: #42843

Change-Id: I6edafe8edeb8549f324959e7a1ec175c3049a515
(cherry picked from commit 5531d5cee744f90ff24231a9ef467282b254adc2)

commit_message:
Force immediate NTP time sync with chronyd at IPA startup

In order to make sure we have the correct time early, e.g.
by the time we create a TLS certificate, this patch proposes
to force an immediate NTP update when using chronyd. While
the previous approach uses the passed NTP server as well, the
update may happen only after chronyd has performed measurements
(which may be too late).

Story: #2009058
Task: #42843

Change-Id: I6edafe8edeb8549f324959e7a1ec175c3049a515
(cherry picked from commit 5531d5cee744f90ff24231a9ef467282b254adc2)

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 08:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 10:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 08:05:27.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: use docker_yum_gpgkey to fetch docker GPG key

Currently, if you override docker_yum_url, the repo must contain a GPG
key at {{ docker_yum_url }}/gpg, despite the fact that the GPG key URL
can be overridden separately via docker_yum_gpgkey. This change uses
docker_yum_gpgkey consistently, avoiding the need to keep the key in the
repo.

Closes-Bug: #1934913
Change-Id: If8e6a02ce0760123f7b076c711727ef575965192
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: use docker_yum_gpgkey to fetch docker GPG key

Currently, if you override docker_yum_url, the repo must contain a GPG
key at {{ docker_yum_url }}/gpg, despite the fact that the GPG key URL
can be overridden separately via docker_yum_gpgkey. This change uses
docker_yum_gpgkey consistently, avoiding the need to keep the key in the
repo.

Closes-Bug: #1934913
Change-Id: If8e6a02ce0760123f7b076c711727ef575965192

commit_message:
ironic: Follow up for ironic_enable_keystone_integration

Follow up for I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9 which added a
ironic_enable_keystone_integration variable to support Ironic in
multi-region environments. This change skips Keystone service
registration based on ironic_enable_keystone_integration rather than
enable_keystone. It also updates the ironic-inspector.conf template to
use the new variable.

Change-Id: I2ecba4999e194766258ac5beed62877d43829313

commit_message:
Add caps for pip-extra-reqs/pip-missing-reqs

pip-check-reqs fails with latest pip, cap both packages until
https://github.com/r1chardj0n3s/pip-check-reqs/issues/66 is fixed.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Thiemonge <gthiemon@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6ae2740557f0e62b6805e5dadd025e7bf44ec57d

subject: monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-10 13:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 33469, 'date': '2021-08-10 19:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 07:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\napproving clean backport (contents approved by others on master)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 13:07:29.000000000', 'message': 'monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm

monasca-thresh currently runs a local copy of the storm
to handle the threshold topology.  However, it doesn't setup
the environment correctly, and the executable fails, causing
the container to continually restart.

This patch updates the container command to correctly
submit the topology to the running Apache storm.  The
container will exit after it finishes the submission,
so the restart_policy is updated to on-failure, this way
if the storm is temporarily unavailable, the submission
will be retried. (NOTE: further deploys will see the
container as "changed" as it won't be running)

Patch uses KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP to trigger the container to
check if the topology is already submitted, and if so skips
the submission command so the container doesn't fail.

The config task now triggers a new reconfigure handler that
spawns a one-shot container to replace any existing topology
if the configuration has changed.

Also, all the storm.* variables in storm.yml.j2 are
removed as they were only needed for local mode and
make submitted topologies fail to load when the storm
is restarted (the referenced directories not mounted
on nimbus).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804020
Closes-Bug: #1808805
Change-Id: Ib225d76076782d695c9387e1c2693bae9a4521d7
(cherry picked from commit aea9bf355058a15e7ce7bb2649de3872e7041c89)
'}]
commit_message:
monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm

monasca-thresh currently runs a local copy of the storm
to handle the threshold topology.  However, it doesn't setup
the environment correctly, and the executable fails, causing
the container to continually restart.

This patch updates the container command to correctly
submit the topology to the running Apache storm.  The
container will exit after it finishes the submission,
so the restart_policy is updated to on-failure, this way
if the storm is temporarily unavailable, the submission
will be retried. (NOTE: further deploys will see the
container as "changed" as it won't be running)

Patch uses KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP to trigger the container to
check if the topology is already submitted, and if so skips
the submission command so the container doesn't fail.

The config task now triggers a new reconfigure handler that
spawns a one-shot container to replace any existing topology
if the configuration has changed.

Also, all the storm.* variables in storm.yml.j2 are
removed as they were only needed for local mode and
make submitted topologies fail to load when the storm
is restarted (the referenced directories not mounted
on nimbus).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804020
Closes-Bug: #1808805
Change-Id: Ib225d76076782d695c9387e1c2693bae9a4521d7
(cherry picked from commit aea9bf355058a15e7ce7bb2649de3872e7041c89)

commit_message:
monasca-thresh: Fix topology submission to storm

monasca-thresh currently runs a local copy of the storm
to handle the threshold topology.  However, it doesn't setup
the environment correctly, and the executable fails, causing
the container to continually restart.

This patch updates the container command to correctly
submit the topology to the running Apache storm.  The
container will exit after it finishes the submission,
so the restart_policy is updated to on-failure, this way
if the storm is temporarily unavailable, the submission
will be retried. (NOTE: further deploys will see the
container as "changed" as it won't be running)

Patch uses KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP to trigger the container to
check if the topology is already submitted, and if so skips
the submission command so the container doesn't fail.

The config task now triggers a new reconfigure handler that
spawns a one-shot container to replace any existing topology
if the configuration has changed.

Also, all the storm.* variables in storm.yml.j2 are
removed as they were only needed for local mode and
make submitted topologies fail to load when the storm
is restarted (the referenced directories not mounted
on nimbus).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804019
Closes-Bug: #1808805
Change-Id: Ib225d76076782d695c9387e1c2693bae9a4521d7
(cherry picked from commit aea9bf355058a15e7ce7bb2649de3872e7041c89)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Explicity set IPE job to ML2/OVS

Neutron in Devstack is default to OVN backend, since Ironic
doesn't work with it we need to explicity disable.

Change-Id: I193d59efc4ac48558f5682971daef73f5c881a92

commit_message:
stable only: Fix failing jobs and make l-c non-voting

Fix pep8 with missing isort, networking-bgpvpn-dsvm-functional with
ensuring tox, and make lower-constraints job non-voting.
Remove tools/test-setup.sh and let zuul setup database.

Default nodeset was set to focal in zuul and requirements-check job
started to fail in stable/stein. This patch sets ubuntu-bionic as
nodeset for the job to make it pass. doc/requirements.txt has to be
updated with the correct sphinx requirement constraints to make the
requirements-check job pass.

Change-Id: I3d49c6dcf004d1ae216d20aa9b59e199c21d61f1

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: Ia94b1769233957b6718878a136f1da91eb1a2d8f

[{'created': '2021-08-11 08:22:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add suppress_type_name to stop warnings with ES7

When using elasticsearch 7 with fluentd, you seem to get a lot
of warnings in the docker logs output that look like:

    [types removal] Specifying types in bulk requests is deprecated.

The docs suggest adding suppress_type_name to stop these warnings,
and that seems to work without affecting any functionality.

Further info here:
https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/issues/785

Closes-Bug: #1930856
Change-Id: I45be67df3717f78d78bcdc7df69600ab8681922f
'}]
commit_message:
Add suppress_type_name to stop warnings with ES7

When using elasticsearch 7 with fluentd, you seem to get a lot
of warnings in the docker logs output that look like:

    [types removal] Specifying types in bulk requests is deprecated.

The docs suggest adding suppress_type_name to stop these warnings,
and that seems to work without affecting any functionality.

Further info here:
https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/issues/785

Closes-Bug: #1930856
Change-Id: I45be67df3717f78d78bcdc7df69600ab8681922f

commit_message:
Add missing elasticsearch cloudkitty storage
and prometheus collector backend support.

* Fix various remaining typos.
* Fix trailing character on reno.
* Enable Elasticsearch when selected as cloudkitty backend.
* Add a check for ES index creation when ES required.
* Add a release note
* Fix release note line length issue.

Change-Id: I18f3d8f2e10a2996b2ebf92733a1770bef548bda
Closes-bug: #1895945
(cherry picked from commit 9e72c0cb4e2206cc72104648e507237977258d54)

hum... don't get it, this is an improvement to an already existing feature, I've keep the defaults as they were exactly in order for operators to not get surprised.

I really don't think their will be any issue here, everything is optional."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-02 10:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

In general, I agree we should be cautious about backporting features.

In this case, there may be an argument for supporting the Elasticsearch storage backend. As this bug report [1] highlights, our InfluxDB setup is not HA, and is broken out of the box with multiple nodes. The Elasticsearch backend does not have this limitation. The ES backend in cloudkitty is more recent however, and was experimental for a while. Is it production ready in victoria or ussuri?

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1937908'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-05 14:45:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree this is low risk. Please answer Mark's comment and I think we could merge."}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-08-05 18:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Still the source code didn't updated the python warning message tho.
TBH: I'm using it in production on large scale since about more than a year now and it's working just fine."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-09 09:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 07:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Add missing elasticsearch cloudkitty storage
and prometheus collector backend support.

* Fix various remaining typos.
* Fix trailing character on reno.
* Enable Elasticsearch when selected as cloudkitty backend.
* Add a check for ES index creation when ES required.
* Add a release note
* Fix release note line length issue.

Change-Id: I18f3d8f2e10a2996b2ebf92733a1770bef548bda
Closes-bug: #1895945
(cherry picked from commit 9e72c0cb4e2206cc72104648e507237977258d54)

commit_message:
Use payloads for PORT SUBNET and SECURITY_GROUPS events

Recently some changes landed in Neutron to use publish instead of the
old deprecated notify and change from kwargs to payload, examples:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/796011
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797004
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/792895

This patch tries to cover these in networking-odl, and adds shims to
handle the mixed calls.

Change-Id: I977a3d163f7f2fc01f93d580d051c77d55c4fe4a

commit_message:
Fix freezed spice console in horizon

This trivial patch is setting "timeout tunnel" in haproxy's
configuration for spicehtml5proxy. This option extends time
when spice's websocket connection is closed, so spice will
not be freezed. Default value is set to 1h as it is in novnc.

Closes-Bug: #1938549
Change-Id: I3a5cd98ecf4916ebd0748e7c08111ad0e4dca0b2
(cherry picked from commit c281a018c41bf1819d6b92343ef4871337702e6f)

commit_message:
Fix freezed spice console in horizon

This trivial patch is setting "timeout tunnel" in haproxy's
configuration for spicehtml5proxy. This option extends time
when spice's websocket connection is closed, so spice will
not be freezed. Default value is set to 1h as it is in novnc.

Closes-Bug: #1938549
Change-Id: I3a5cd98ecf4916ebd0748e7c08111ad0e4dca0b2

Use bgp api-def from neutron-lib

As neutron-dynamic-routing is a Neutron stadium project the api-def
and the api-ref should be in neutron-lib.

to check if a topology exists in Storm, and optionally kill it.

This is part of a bug in kolla-ansible where topologies were
not submitted to Storm, but run locally.  This patch includes
a topology check script enabled by KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP which will exit
kolla_start if the topology exists, and optionally enables topology
removal (to allow replacement) enabled by TOPOLOGY_REPLACE.

Topology names and various timeouts may be customized.  If the

subject: Fix ppc64le support to coexist with PXE preference
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-09 23:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-10 14:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-11 05:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 23:26:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix ppc64le support to coexist with PXE preference

In essence, the pxe preference doesn't apply to ppc64le.

This is because PXE data loading is part of the firmware and
does not use an intermediate boot loader like ipxe, syslinux,
or even grub.

Changes the logic to always set the stage for PXE based
deployments and enables boot setting awareness for ppc64le
based on the TFTP defaults. This allows ppc64le to coexist
with an environment preferring HTTP transport like those
used with iPXE.

Change-Id: I27fa53700c1b44f14725bc66b929732553da58f8
(cherry picked from commit da503fd5ceabb5bd466e45f1da51442ef66d8ce7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ppc64le support to coexist with PXE preference

In essence, the pxe preference doesn't apply to ppc64le.

This is because PXE data loading is part of the firmware and
does not use an intermediate boot loader like ipxe, syslinux,
or even grub.

Changes the logic to always set the stage for PXE based
deployments and enables boot setting awareness for ppc64le
based on the TFTP defaults. This allows ppc64le to coexist
with an environment preferring HTTP transport like those
used with iPXE.

Change-Id: I27fa53700c1b44f14725bc66b929732553da58f8
(cherry picked from commit da503fd5ceabb5bd466e45f1da51442ef66d8ce7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 15:53:24.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Provide an option duing creation of volume from snapshot

A new extra spec has been added on the volume.
While creating volume from snapshot, its value is checked and
volume is created either as a snapshot/independent copy.

Details of extra spec:
Name - hpe3par:convert_to_base
Value - True/False; defaults to False

True: Volume (from snapshot) is created independently
Advantage: new volumes are decoupled from initial snapshot and original
volume
Usage: where instances are launched for longer/unpredictable time frame

False: Volume (from snapshot) is created as child of snapshot
Advantage: new volumes can be created quickly
Usage: where many similar instances are launched for short time frame

Change-Id: Idda5512d8e35da401ee232524ec1d1fcd03bf9e2
Closes-Bug: #1814027
(cherry picked from commit f8084991284acfd8e0cd80ed456a83bcec6d5dcc)
'}, {'created': '2021-03-22 07:49:13.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Provide an option duing creation of volume from snapshot

Value - True/False; defaults to False

True: Volume (from snapshot) is created independently
Advantage: new volumes are decoupled from initial snapshot and original
volume
Usage: where instances are launched for longer/unpredictable time frame

False: Volume (from snapshot) is created as child of snapshot

(cherry picked from commit f8084991284acfd8e0cd80ed456a83bcec6d5dcc)
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Provide an option duing creation of volume from snapshot

A new extra spec has been added on the volume.
While creating volume from snapshot, its value is checked and
volume is created either as a snapshot/independent copy.

Details of extra spec:
Name - hpe3par:convert_to_base
Value - True/False; defaults to False

True: Volume (from snapshot) is created independently
Advantage: new volumes are decoupled from initial snapshot and original
volume
Usage: where instances are launched for longer/unpredictable time frame

False: Volume (from snapshot) is created as child of snapshot
Advantage: new volumes can be created quickly
Usage: where many similar instances are launched for short time frame

Change-Id: Idda5512d8e35da401ee232524ec1d1fcd03bf9e2
Closes-Bug: #1814027
(cherry picked from commit f8084991284acfd8e0cd80ed456a83bcec6d5dcc)

commit_message:
Add oidc options

Add additional OIDC Options to allow for user defined configuration.

This change adds:
keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_pass_userinfo_as
keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_pass_claim_as

Change-Id: Id093956a4c88cfe1f70aa93ecc87da5850bb185c

commit_message:
Deprecate invalid ironic_api_paste_ini

Ironic has never used api-paste.ini but defines pipeline in code.
The ironic_api_paste_ini resource type to manage api-paste.ini is
deprecated because the resource is just invalid.

Change-Id: I5fc1d691642f184b6fdd4bfcba5314b3ea11b583

Replace deprecated database_connection of puppet base classes

Database parameters in base classes were deprecated in favor of
duplicated parameters in independent db classes.

[{'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-09 16:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-05-10 16:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm a little confused as this patch adds a restart trigger on the /etc/default/neutron-dhcp-agent, however you state that the openvswitch_agent.ini file might need to cause a restart of the neutron-dhcp-agent and that is not tracked anywhere in this patch set. i.e. a change can edit the openvswitch_agent.ini file but the neutron-dhcp-agent will not be restarted because its not triggering on changes to that file."}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-11 14:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-11 14:04:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'm a little confused as this patch adds a restart trigger on the /etc/default/neutron-dhcp-agent, however you state that the openvswitch_agent.ini file might need to cause a restart of the neutron-dhcp-agent and that is not tracked anywhere in this patch set. i.e. a change can edit the openvswitch_agent.ini file but the neutron-dhcp-agent will not be restarted because its not triggering on changes to that file.

Hi Billy, you are right. I missed a trigger on openvswitch_agent.ini. Added it now."}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-11 14:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-11 14:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-05-12 13:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Only qs raised is that this will most likely make the dhcp-agent restart on charm upgrade, but I guess that is OK taking into account the level of interruption that would have on data-plane (it would only affect instances booting at that exact moment).

I also have a question in-line.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-06-18 14:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-01 17:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-07-03 03:17:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Can we be a bit more specific about when we will trigger the restart on charm upgrade? AIUI, this only affects installations which are using DPDK, but we will *always* restart the neutron-dhcp service on upgrade. While the neutron-dhcp service is less onerous to restart vs openvswitch itself, we should strive to only restart the services when necessary. There is already logic in the upgrade-charm hook to handle a change to the openvswitch config files and avoiding a restart of openvswitch and I think something similar can apply here.

Additionally, since it *will* perform a restart for the DPDK scenario with the above change made, we'll need a release not associated with this as well."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2021-07-07 06:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>
'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-07 19:48:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi Billy,

Can you please point that out to me? Im looking at the install hook but I don't see where it calls a restart you are telling. I'm not too familiar with this mechanism.

Erlon"}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 13:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 13:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 14:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

Done, release note also added:  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-guide/+/800661'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 14:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 18:12:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Can we be a bit more specific about when we will trigger the restart on charm upgrade? AIUI, this only affects installations which are using DPDK, but we will *always* restart the neutron-dhcp service on upgrade. While the neutron-dhcp service is less onerous to restart vs openvswitch itself, we should strive to only restart the services when necessary. There is already logic in the upgrade-charm hook to handle a change to the openvswitch config files and avoiding a restart of openvswitch and I think something similar can apply here.
> 
> Additionally, since it *will* perform a restart for the DPDK scenario with the above change made, we'll need a release not associated with this as well.

Regarding the release note, I did it[1] but i a second thought, I believe we better not to add it, since theres no visible impact to the user and no action needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-guide/+/800661"}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2021-07-13 18:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Adds Neutron OVS agent config to DHCP daemon

The neutron-dhcp-agent might rely on options defined in
openvswitch_agent.ini. By default this config file is not passed to
neutron-dhcp-agent daemon, and therefore those options are not
loaded and fall back for the default values and by that inhibits
the desired behavior.

Charm helpers' PR: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/615

Depends-on: I39024855c3e42ee135b6ad5e7618a770219b6994

Closes-bug: #1832021
Change-Id: I134c8077ee52ccdb4e383109ecbea27ed1633fb8

The neutron_api_config type was deprecated in Victoria[1] because it is
a duplicate of neutron_api_paste_ini.
Because of that deprecation wow usage of neutron::config::api_config
relies on neutron_api_paste_ini instead of neutron_api_config, thus

commit_message:
Replace deprecated neutron_api_config

The neutron_api_config type was deprecated in Victoria[1] because it is
a duplicate of neutron_api_paste_ini.
Because of that deprecation now usage of neutron::config::api_config
relies on neutron_api_paste_ini instead of neutron_api_config, thus
the puppet tags should be updated accordingly.

[1] 2daa0b16444f2a2a865b618cbca76fd18c6cd7c6
